goal.core.program.literals

Class MentalStateCond

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.literals.MentalStateCond
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class MentalStateCond
extends ParsedObject
    Mental state conditions occur as conditions in the rules of a GOAL program but are also used for other purposes.

    Mental state conditions are conjunctions of mental atoms and are represented as a list of belief and goal literals. The order of literals is important for evaluation. Because GOAL also allows the use of macros, a mental state condition is represented as a list of MentalFormulas.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • MentalStateCond

        public MentalStateCond(java.util.List<MentalFormula> formulas,
               InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates a MentalStateCond from a list of MentalFormula. Mental state conditions occur as conditions in the rules of a GOAL program but are also used for other purposes.
        Parameters:
        formulas - The formulas from which the mental state condition is created.
        source - The location of definition of the mental state condition in the source code. May be null if not created by a parser.

      • getSubFormulas

        public java.util.List<MentalFormula> getSubFormulas()
        Returns the sub-MentalFormulas of this MentalStateCond, where a sub-formula may be a Macro or a MentalLiteral. Use getLiterals() if macro's are not important (i.e. use getSubFormulas() only for presentation purposes, when the orginal definition of this MentalStateCond is needed.
        Returns:
        A List of the sub-formulas of this mental state condition.

      • evaluate

        public java.util.Set<Substitution> evaluate(Substitution substitution,
                                   MentalState mentalState,
                                   Debugger debugger)
        Evaluates this MentalStateCond. First applies a given Substitution to the condition and then evaluates the condition on the given MentalState.
        Parameters:
        substitution - The substitution to be applied to the mental state condition.
        mentalState - The mental state on which the condition is evaluated.
        debugger - The SteppingDebugger to report on.
        Returns:
        The set of substitutions for which this mental state condition holds in the given mental state. If empty the condition does not hold; if non-empty, each of the resulting substitutions includes the original substitution provided as a parameter. For example, if the given substitution is {X/1} and the condition is bel(on(X,Y)), then any of the resulting substitutions will be of the form {X/1, Y/..}.

      • evaluate

        public java.util.Set<Substitution> evaluate(MentalState mentalState,
                                   Debugger debugger)
        Evaluates this MentalStateCond on the given MentalState.
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The mental state on which the condition is evaluated.
        debugger - The Debugger to report on.
        Returns:
        The set of substitutions for which this mental state condition holds in the given mental state. If non-empty the condition holds, otherwise it does not hold.
